data.name: RtxtQA.Text
data.value:
1. What do you understand by the term ‘Visual Programming Environment? Give an example of ‘Visual Programming Environment’. Software which allows the use of visual expressions (such as graphics, drawings, animations, or icons) in the process of programming.
2. What do you understand by the term ‘Visual Studio’? Briefly describe four main features of the ‘Visual Studio’. It is used to develop computer programs, as well as websites, web apps, web services and mobile apps main features: -Develop - Navigate, write and fix code fast. -Debug - Debug, profile and diagnose with ease. -Test - Write high-quality code with comprehensive testing tools. -Extend - Choose from thousands of extension to customise your IDE.
3. What do you understand by the term '.NET'? .NET framework includes a large class library and provides language interoperability across several programming languages.
4. List and describe the three major components of the .NET Framework. FCL - Framework Class Library is a collection of classes, namespaces, interfaces, and value types that are used for .NET applications. CLR - Common Runtime Error manages and executes the code written in any .NET programming language. Itconverts code into native code which further can be executed by the CPU. CLS - Common Language Specification defines set of rules and restrictions that every language must follow which runs under the .NET framework. CTS - Common Type System describes the datatypes that can be used by managed code if describes how these types are declared, used and managed in the runtime.
5: Programs written under the .NET framework undergo two compilation process. Why do we need two compilation processes? So that it can be run by the OS.
6. Briefly explain what are ‘Namespaces’ in the .NET Framework. Namespace is a way that is used for logical grouping of functionalities. It allows us to organise the code in a much cleaner way.
7. Name any two .NET Framework Namespaces you know. System.web System.Netand
8. In VS NET the code you create is organized using different layers of grouping. Briefly explain the purpose of each of these layers: Solutions - Has a solution file that keeps track of the projects that make up the solution. Projects - Has one project file that keeps track of the files that make up a project and records various settings for the project. Files - Form files now have a suffix of .vb! Solution Explorer - A tool window and is typically docked along the right edge of the IDE. Toolbox - Provides various controls to include in the code like groupbox, combobox... Properties Window - A tool window.
9. List the three main programming languages under the .NET Framework. Visual basic .net Visual c# .net Visual c++ .net
10.What does ‘IDE’ stand for? Briefly describe what is an IDE. Integrated Development Environment enables programmes to consolidate the different aspects of writing a computer program.
